title: Football news: Rabbi Matondo inspired by Gordon Ramsey after joining Schalke
text:
Rabbi Matondo has turned to Gordon Ramsay rather than Aaron Ramsey as he seeks the recipe for success in European football.

The former Manchester City youngster, who is preparing for Wales' Euro 2020 qualifying double-header against Slovakia and Croatia, scored his first goal for Schalke in a 3-1 win over Leipzig last month, following his £11million move from City in January.

Matondo, 19, is still establishing himself outside English football - the same as Ramsey, who left Arsenal for Juventus in the summer after coming to the end of his contract in north London.

Rabbi Matondo has been with the Wales senior side this week as they prepare to face Slovakia

He recently revealed he had been inspired by Ramsay, but it's Gordon (right), not Aaron (left)

Yet it is the midfielder's more famous namesake who has been inspiring Matondo in Germany.

Matondo said: 'I go on Gordon Ramsay a lot on YouTube and see what you can cook up. I try to copy.

'It's not quite similar but I try my best. I am not around any distractions of living in Cardiff or Manchester with my friends.

'It's nice to be around your friends but [living] alone I just do more for myself. That's improved me. I am doing little extras, going to the gym and eating good food.'

Matondo admitted: ''I go on Gordon Ramsay a lot on YouTube and see what you can cook'

Matondo, who has three caps for Wales, is attempting to emulate the success of fellow City youth product Jadon Sancho, now one of the most exciting players in the world since he joined Borussia Dortmund two years ago.

Sancho is close to establishing himself as an England regular and would command a huge transfer fee were he ever to leave.

Matondo added: 'If I can do as well as he has done so far then I will be really happy. He is a great player.

'I have always known that since being at Manchester City with him, how good he can be and how good he will be. Hopefully he can help me as well.'
